Ousted From Juna Akhada? IIT Baba Makes Abrupt Exit From Maha Kumbh - News18
summary:
IIT Baba's Sudden Departure from Maha Kumbh Raises Concerns

Date: January 18, 2025, Source: News18

The once-popular 'IIT Baba', Abhey Singh, abruptly exited the Maha Kumbh Mela, generating significant concern among his followers. His disappearance follows a series of media interactions that contributed to growing mental stress.

  • Abhey Singh, known for his transition from aerospace engineering to spirituality, left the Maha Kumbh and Juna Akhada.
  • His family and ashram sadhus are worried as he has been unreachable and cut off contact.
  • Reports suggest mental stress and drug use contributed to his decision to leave.
  • The Juna Akhada's strict media protocols may have led to friction over Singh's rising popularity.
  • Singh has previously expressed his journey from engineering to seeking deeper spiritual meaning.
“You will keep searching for the meaning of life. I used to find that in engineering but never found my answers,” said Singh.

Abhey Singh's sudden decision raises questions about the pressures faced by public figures in spiritual communities, warranting a call for more support and understanding.
newTitle: IIT Baba's Sudden Departure from Maha Kumbh Raises Concerns

BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination From New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases, Assets - News18
summary:
BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination from New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases and Asset Discrepancies

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: News18

The BJP has filed a complaint challenging the nomination of Arvind Kejriwal for the New Delhi Assembly seat, citing income discrepancies, failure to disclose criminal cases, and voter registration issues.

  • The complaint was filed by BJP candidate Parvesh Verma.
  • Allegations include incorrect income figures reported in Kejriwal's affidavits for the years 2019-2023.
  • Concerns were raised regarding Kejriwal’s voter registration, which reportedly appears in multiple locations.
  • The complaint also highlights four FIRs against Kejriwal that were not disclosed.
  • Delhi Assembly elections for all 70 constituencies are scheduled for February 5, with results on February 8.
“I have filed the nomination. I would like to tell the people of Delhi that please vote for work...” - Arvind Kejriwal

This challenge to Kejriwal’s nomination comes at a critical time as the Delhi Assembly elections approach, raising questions about the eligibility and transparency of political candidates.
newTitle: BJP Challenges Arvind Kejriwal’s Nomination from New Delhi Seat Over Criminal Cases and Asset Discrepancies

title: Delhi Polls: Kejriwal Announces 'Gamechanger' Free Electricity, Water Scheme For Tenants - News18
summary:
Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: News18

With the Delhi Assembly elections approaching, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) leader Arvind Kejriwal announced a significant policy guaranteeing free electricity and water for tenants, aiming to support his party's electoral campaign.

  • Kejriwal guaranteed free electricity and water for all tenants if AAP is re-elected.
  • The announcement is particularly aimed at benefiting Purvanchali residents, who represent a significant tenant population.
  • He emphasized the current inequalities faced by tenants who do not receive similar benefits as homeowners.
  • This announcement comes on the heels of BJP's manifesto release, pushing AAP to bolster their campaign promises.
“Across Delhi, we have provided free electricity and water to residents. However, it is unfortunate that tenants do not get these benefits.” — Arvind Kejriwal

This scheme reflects AAP's continued focus on welfare initiatives, especially for vulnerable communities as they seek to secure votes in the upcoming elections.
newTitle: Kejriwal Unveils Free Utilities Scheme for Tenants Ahead of Delhi Elections

title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: CBI demands maximum punishment for Sanjay Roy - Hindustan Times
summary:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Demands Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The RG Kar rape case has concluded with the court finding accused Sanjay Roy guilty of the rape and murder of a 31-year-old trainee doctor. A significant outcry followed the case, leading to nationwide protests for justice.

  • The victim was discovered dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024, after being raped.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested after police identified him via a Bluetooth device found near the crime scene.
  • The case fueled widespread protests by junior doctors demanding better security measures in hospitals.
  • The trial commenced on November 12 with Judge Anirban Das overseeing proceedings that involved 50 witnesses and concluded on January 9.
The CBI's lawyer stated, “We demanded maximum possible punishment for Sanjay Roy.”

The case has raised significant concerns over safety in medical facilities and the need for more robust legal actions against such heinous crimes.
newTitle: RG Kar Rape Case Verdict: CBI Seeks Maximum Punishment for Sanjay Roy

Was ‘IIT Baba’ ousted from Mahakumbh Mela ashram? Abhay Singh responds - Hindustan Times
summary:
IIT Baba Denies Allegations Amid Controversy at Mahakumbh Mela

Publication Date: Jan 18, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Abhay Singh, popularly known as IIT Baba, responded to allegations regarding his departure from the Juna Akhara’s ashram, asserting that he was asked to leave rather than having ‘disappeared’ as reported.

  • Singh refuted claims from fellow seers about his mental health and drug use.
  • He stated that the ashram operators feared his newfound fame might expose them.
  • Singh emphasized his background as an aerospace engineering student from IIT Bombay.
  • He shared his journey from a successful career in Canada to spirituality.
“The operators of the Madi Ashram asked me to leave at night. They think I’ve become famous and might expose something about them.” - Abhay Singh

In conclusion, Abhay Singh’s journey reflects a complex intersection of spirituality and personal challenges, as he navigates fame and scrutiny at the Kumbh Mela.
newTitle: IIT Baba Denies Allegations Amid Controversy at Mahakumbh Mela

J-K higher reaches, plains likely to receive intermittent snow till Jan 23, MeT predicts - Greater Kashmir
summary:
J-K higher reaches, plains likely to receive intermittent snow till Jan 23, MeT predicts

Date: January 18

Source: Greater Kashmir

The Meteorological Department has forecasted light snow in isolated areas of Jammu and Kashmir leading up to January 23, with varying weather predictions for the coming days.

  • Very light snow is expected at isolated higher reaches from January 18-21.
  • Generally cloudy conditions predicted with light snow at scattered places from January 20-21.
  • Possibility of light rain in Jammu plains and snow in scattered places on January 22.
  • On January 23, weather is expected to be generally cloudy with light to moderate rain in Jammu and extensive snow across J&K.
  • Dry weather is likely from January 24-27.

The Meteorological Center in Srinagar has advised tourists and travelers to heed advisories from the administration and traffic department for safety.
newTitle: J-K Higher Reaches and Plains to Experience Intermittent Snow Until January 23, According to MeT

title: 8th Pay Commission approved by Cabinet: When will benefits reach central government employees? - Hindustan Times
summary:
8th Pay Commission Approved: Benefits Await Central Government Employees

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The government has approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission, but details on its implementation timeline remain under discussion.

  • The 7th Pay Commission was implemented in January 2016 after being appointed in February 2014.
  • Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw stated that the recommendations of the 8th Pay Commission are expected to be implemented from 2026.
  • Similar to previous commissions, there is an anticipation of a two-year wait for revised pay structures after the commission’s formation.
  • Approximately 50 lakh government employees and 65 lakh pensioners will benefit from the new commission's recommendations.
“Every 10 years, the government constitutes the Pay Commission to review and recommend changes to the salary structure of its employees.”

This significant change is likely to impact a vast number of employees and pensioners, offering revised pay scales and benefits in the near future.
newTitle: 8th Pay Commission Approved: Benefits Await Central Government Employees

title: Weather Update – IMD Warning Rain in Prayagraj Next 4 Days, Here Full Forecast - Times Bull
summary:
Weather Update: IMD Warns of Rain in Prayagraj for the Next 4 Days

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Times Bull

On Friday afternoon, most of Uttar Pradesh experienced sunny weather, providing some relief from the cold that has affected residents in recent days. The IMD predicts changing weather with rain expected from January 21-23, particularly peaking on the 22nd and 23rd.

  • Cold and chill persist, especially affecting Prayagraj and neighboring districts.
  • Weather patterns include dense fog and strong cold winds.
  • The temperature is predicted to drop by 2 degrees, with current maximum temperatures around 22.6 degrees Celsius.
  • Light rain is anticipated to occur in the coming days, particularly during the Maha Kumbh festival.
"महाकुंभ 2025 – भारत मौसम विज्ञान विभाग की ओर से जारी किया गया प्रयागराज क्षेत्र का मौसम पूर्वानुमान एवं चेतावनी।" — India Meteorological Department

Residents should prepare for continued cold conditions and remain aware of potential weather changes in the upcoming days.
newTitle: Weather Update: IMD Warns of Rain in Prayagraj for the Next 4 Days

Bihar Gram Kachahari Sachiv Online Form 2025 (1583 Post) - SarkariExam.com
summary:
Bihar Gram Kachahari Sachiv Online Form 2025 (1583 Post)

Date & Source: January 18, 2025

Source: Panchayati Raj Department (PRD), Govt. of Bihar

Introduction

The Panchayati Raj Department of Bihar has announced the recruitment for the post of Gram Kachahari Sachiv, offering a total of 1583 positions. The online application process commenced on January 16, 2025, and will remain open until January 29, 2025.

Key Points

  • Notification Date: January 16, 2025
  • Application Start Date: January 16, 2025
  • Last Date to Apply: January 29, 2025
  • Application Fee: None for all candidates
  • Age Limit: Maximum age varies by category (UR/EWS: 37m/40f, BC/EBC: 40, SC/ST: 42)
  • Total Posts: 1583
  • Education Qualification: Class 12th pass from a recognized board
  • Selection Mode: Merit list, document verification, and medical examination

Quote: “All candidates must read the official information completely before applying.”

Conclusion

This recruitment is a significant opportunity for eligible candidates looking to secure a job in government service in Bihar.
newTitle: Bihar Gram Kachahari Sachiv Online Form 2025 Announced for 1583 Posts

Delhi Elections 2025: Kejriwal promises free water and electricity for tenants if AAP wins elections - Moneycontrol
summary:
Delhi Elections 2025: Kejriwal promises free water and electricity for tenants if AAP wins elections

Date: January 18, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

In the lead-up to the highly anticipated Delhi assembly election in 2025, party leader Arvind Kejriwal stated on Saturday that tenants in Delhi who are deprived of free water and electricity will be covered by the program once the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) takes power.

  • The assembly election will see voting on February 5, with vote counting on February 8.
  • Kejriwal highlighted the issues faced by tenants, promising them access to free water and electricity.
  • Substantial benefits promised by AAP include ₹10 lakh auto insurance for drivers, free healthcare for the elderly, and ₹2,100 monthly honoraria for women.
  • Kejriwal stated, "Wherever I go, I meet people living on rent who say they benefit from good schools and hospitals but are deprived of free electricity and water schemes."
  • The AAP continues to push its welfare initiatives as its key campaign strategy as elections approach.
"We will ensure that after the elections, tenants, many of whom belong to the Purvanchal region, will also enjoy the benefits of free electricity and water."

The AAP aims to reinforce its position by providing significant benefits to residents, aligning its campaign with community needs and welfare.
newTitle: Kejriwal Promises Free Utilities for Tenants in Delhi Elections 2025

title: Tenants in Delhi to get free electricity, water if AAP comes to power: Arvind Kejriwal - The Times of India
summary:
Delhi Tenants to Receive Free Electricity and Water if AAP Wins Elections

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Chief Minister of Delhi, Arvind Kejriwal, announced that if the AAP party comes to power, tenants in Delhi will benefit from free electricity and water supplies, aiming to provide relief to the common people.

  • The proposal is part of AAP's broader electoral promises.
  • Kejriwal emphasized that this initiative aims to alleviate the financial burden on tenants.
  • The announcement was made during an election rally in Delhi.
“Our government will ensure that no tenant in Delhi has to pay for basic utilities like water and electricity,” said Kejriwal.

This initiative is a strategic move to gain support from the tenant community ahead of the upcoming elections, addressing key issues affecting daily life in the capital.
newTitle: Delhi Tenants to Receive Free Electricity and Water if AAP Wins Elections

RG Kar rape case verdict live: Judgment today by Kolkata court, victim's kin say ‘more involved’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict Expected Today: Victim's Family Claims More Involved

Date: January 18, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

The Kolkata court is set to deliver its first verdict today concerning the alleged rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College. This highly publicized case has resulted in nationwide protests and demands for justice.

  • The victim, a 31-year-old trainee doctor, was found dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested following the discovery of the victim's body, with evidence linking him to the crime.
  • The ongoing trial has sparked significant public outrage and demands for enhanced security in medical facilities.
  • The judgment will be announced by Judge Anirban Das, 57 days post the trial initiation, which included testimonies from 50 witnesses.
“I don't think only one person is involved in this case. Those who have committed financial misconduct in this case are definitely involved…” - Rekha Sharma, former NCW chief

Families of the victim express their belief that the investigation remains incomplete as they suspect others were involved in the crime. The outcome of today's verdict is awaited with hope for justice.
newTitle: RG Kar Rape Case Verdict Expected Today: Victim's Family Claims More Involved

title: 'Mazak bana rakkha hai': Rahul Gandhi meets patients, families sleeping outside AIIMS Delhi, posts video - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rahul Gandhi Addresses Patients and Families Outside AIIMS Delhi

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi of the Congress party met patients and families camping on the roads, footpaths, and subways around AIIMS Delhi, criticizing the central and state governments for their insensitivity.

  • Gandhi's visit coincided with the Delhi assembly elections.
  • He highlighted the struggles faced by patients forced to sleep outdoors amidst cold and lack of basic amenities.
  • Gandhi questioned the government's inaction amid what he described as a humanitarian crisis.
“Hell outside AIIMS! Poor patients and their families from across the country are forced to sleep outside AIIMS amidst the cold, filth, and hunger.” - Rahul Gandhi

Gandhi's statements reflect ongoing concerns regarding health access and governmental accountability, especially ahead of the elections.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi Addresses Patients and Families Outside AIIMS Delhi

title: 'Escaped death by 25 minutes': Sheikh Hasina on surviving ‘conspiracy to kill her’ in Bangladesh - Hindustan Times
summary:
‘Escaped death by 25 minutes’: Sheikh Hasina on surviving ‘conspiracy to kill her’ in Bangladesh

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: HT News Desk

Former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has claimed there were several conspiracies to assassinate her throughout her life, highlighting her narrow escape from an alleged attempt last year. She emphasized that her survival is due to a will of Allah.

  • Hasina alleges multiple assassination attempts, with the latest occurring on August 5, 2024.
  • Over 600 casualties were reported during protests against her government.
  • She currently resides in India after fleeing her country due to the political crisis.
  • Hasina faces arrest warrants in Bangladesh related to crimes during her premiership.
“Surviving the killings on August 21, or surviving the huge bomb in Kotalipara, there must be a will of Allah.”

This situation highlights the ongoing political instability in Bangladesh and the contentious allegations against Hasina, now in exile.
newTitle: Sheikh Hasina Survives Alleged Assassination Attempts Amid Political Turmoil
